page.title: 06TRANSPORT IN SUNNINGDALE
page.content: Local people look back fondly to the days when public transport cost very little.Even so,there were less cars than nowadays and people often walked to wherever they were going.Fifty years ago the original station still existed.It was made of brick and had a booking-office,parcels room,2 waiting rooms with fires in the winter and a station masters house which had a well kept garden and was on the 'upside!' The present flat-roofed booking office is not as attractive and nearly always has a puddle of water on top.The area where the garden used to be has become an informal rubbish dump and the old sidings are now a car park.The new automatic level crossing seems to hold traffic up longer than the old ones but this may be because there is now more traffic commuting from these 'rurbian' dormitories to London.
